name: Platzl Hotel

reviews.title: Great location, rooms and service.
reviews.text: This hotel is excellently located to the main square and right on the Platzl. Easy walking to all main attractions and lots of restaurant. Rooms are spacious, well appointed, with nice bathrooms. Service is excellent, staff and front desk very helpful. They arranged private touring for us to Dachau, Salzburg, and Bechtesgarten. Breakfasts are excellent. I would highly recommend, worth the price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You can't beat the convenience of this hotel - easy walking distance to shopping, eating, public transportation and tourist attractions. We've stayed here a number of times and enjoy the good service, great breakfast & clean rooms. Try to get a room on the side away from the Hofbrau Haus, it can get a little noisy at night otherwise. Only thing missing is free wi-fi.
reviews.title: Love this hotel

reviews.text: We LOVED this hotel. The breakfast was awesome, the room was clean and the bathroom was updated and clean. Not to mention the soaps smelled really good. The location is unbeatable, and we walked everywhere we needed to go. It is very close to the Marianplatz and Hofbrauhaus, but on a side street, so not too crowded. The staff was great and atmosphere was pleasant.
reviews.title: Exceptional Hotel

reviews.text: Infrequent visitors to independant hotels in Germany may think that the rooms here are on the small side, but believe you me they are quite large for similar establishments in Munich, even, I understand, the international chains who generally sell on familiarity. No bath but the normal shower, work desk, flat screen TV (only one English channel and no pay TV), minibar and small open wardrobe. For a longish stay a lack of draw space but no different than any other hotel I stayed at in Munich.
reviews.title: Bavarian excellence in Central Munich

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Internet available in the room via ethernet which they provide but sometimes run out so take your own. Cost 4Euros/24 hours. Wifi also available but the cost a wapping 22Euros! Why?
reviews.title: overrated and overpriced

reviews.text: An absolutely great German hotel located convenient to transit and all the downtown Munich tourist sites/old town/ museums... very friendly and attentive staff, has a safe/convenient parking located right under the hotel, is located near many restaurants such as the famous beer hall - the Hofbrauhaus. Accomodation includes a delicious breakfast buffet with a wide selection of hot/cold foods/beverages including champagne. I have now stayed here twice and will definately return as it is great value for what you pay/ the location just can't be beat/ and almost as important as the above, it has a nice Bavarian architecture/interior decorating -- you definately feel as if you are in Germany rather than a typical hotel chain room that could be anywhere.
reviews.title: Superb hotel next to Marienplatz/Hofbrauhaus

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for one night in August. We arrived in Munich by train and were relieved to find this hotel was an easy walk from the station. It is situated near to the Old Town square and the food market in a very convenient location. The hotel staff were extremely pleasant and helpful; In fact, this was the only hotel we stayed at that sent us several emails before our visit telling us about the hotel and things to do in the surrounding area! The hotel itself is spacious, clean and friendly. We were rather sorry we couldn't stay longer and hope to return to this hotel one day.
reviews.title: Great location and excellent staff

reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Platzl Hotel and were pleasantly surprised and impressed. It is hands-down the best location in Munich for visiting tourist sites (Hofbrauhaus, Vitkulienmarkt, Residnez, etc) and is very close to Marienplatz and the metro (5 minute walk). The rooms were large and clean with modern bathrooms. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, especially Susanne who assisted us in tracking down our lost luggage!
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Munich

reviews.text: The only negatives for the hotel would be the lack of wifi (only wired internet is available in the rooms, for a small fee- wifi is available in the lobby only but very expensive), and there are no irons available for use. If you want clothes ironed, you have to pay to have them sent out. All in all, this did not overly detract from our visit but would have been nice amenities.
reviews.title: Stay here, look no further

reviews.text: We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in Munich- we plan to stay there whenever we return!
reviews.title: THE Place to Stay in Munich!
Great location
reviews.text: We stayed 6 nights at the Platz at the beginning of September. We had a nice room, the service was good and the breakfast fantastic with lots of choices. The hotel is within easy walking distance of the metro and the pedestrian center. We had asked for a quiet room and were slightly concerned when we arrived because the room faced an interior delivery area for the restaurant. But, the room was quiet and we were happy. We had a great stay at the Platz and would recommend to everyone.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Platzl is in a perfect location, and the hotel itself is quite nice and a good deal. And if they don't steal from you and hang back up from the floor dirty towels, I would recommend it.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but they stole from us and didn't clean room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife had a makeup compact taken from the bathroom while we were out for the day. We have never, ever accused anyone of something like this, but there is really no doubt that the makeup was stolen. On top of that, the towels we left on the floor were just hung back up rather than replaced (my wife's eyeliner -- the one stolen actually -- was still on the towels).
reviews.title: This is the only Hotel we stay at in Munich

reviews.text: We told the front desk about this and they acted very concerned and said they would email us about it, as we were checking out that day. This never happened. After receiving an email request from the hotel to write them up on TripAdvisor (you're welcome, Platzl), I reminded them of our issue. No response.
reviews.title: Good value & Excellent location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is NEVER one complaint when we have stayed at the Platzl. We have stayed there at least ten times! The location is wonderful, close to MarienPlatz and very close to the S Bahn. The staff is very friendly and helpful. They sold us tickets for the S Bahn, mailed letters and gave wonderful advice and directions to where we wanted to go. The breakfast is wonderful; in a very beautiful dining room. The wait staff was very friendly and prompt with our coffee. (Very important to me!) The rooms were clean and very comfortable. So many wonderful restaurants near by - hard to pick! Susan from Madison, Wisconsin
reviews.title: MW

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This great hotel in an absolutely fantastic location, set right in the Old Town and perfect to access all the sights. Our room was on the 3rd floor, away from the street, so very quiet. The room was not overly large, but well appointed, clean and a comfortable bed. The Reception staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was great, huge selection to choose from. Because of the location, you are spoilt for choice for dining at night.
reviews.title: Absolutely Perfect Location

reviews.text: Very nice hotel with friendly stuff, excellent rooms, very close to city center and quiet enough.
reviews.title: The first time in Munich

reviews.text: Very good coffee in lobby bar and a wide selection on breakfast.
reviews.title: Good choice, central and comfy
Great spot but can be noisy
reviews.text: We ever found a couple of russian TV channels in room TV

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like everything in life it all depends on what you are expecting. I am very well travelled and LOOVE great and fancy hotels, nevertheless many times (most) I have to meet a budget.
reviews.title: best choise in central Munich

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 2 nites in early June. Hotel is big but very good. Very helpful staff. Excellent location to center of Munich. Great breakfast. Big, clean, quiet rooms. What more could you need.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: I have been to Munich several times for work and this hotel for now on will be my first choice to stay. The location is right in the middle of Munich, around the corner from Marienplatz and the Hofbrau house. The rooms were decent size, modern, and clean. The service was fantastic. The breakfast was very good as well. I will definitely be staying here on my return trips to Munich.
reviews.title: Location, location, location

reviews.text: Stayed in Munich for business for 2 days and wanted a more authentic experience than the usual business hotels. The Platzl hotel is excellent and a great value for the price. Friendly, warm Bavarian service, excellent breakfast buffet and you cannot beat the location right next to Hofbraeuhaus and a few minute walk to Marienplatz, U-bahn and all beergardens. Internet is fast and the staff is happy to accomodate wishes. Will book again next time.
reviews.title: In the middle of the heart of Munich

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful visit to Munich. Our visit was made even better by our excellent stay at the Platzl. The location is ideal and the service was great. The hotel is very clean and the room comfortable. The breakfast was delicious and plentiful. If we are fortunate enough to get back to Munich, our first plan would be to call the Platzl. We didn't check out the pool or spa, but I'm sure they are at the same level as the rest of the Platzl. The Platzl Hotel is a must stay in Munich.
reviews.title: A Must Stay!

reviews.text: Very well appointed hotel with an excellent location; within walking distance of attractions and the S-Bahn for other connections. One of the best hotel breakfast spreads I've enjoyed. The actual rooms are typically German; simple but clean and efficient. Also, very friendly bartender who makes wonderful Bloody Marys at the hotel bar. I will definitely stay there again when in Munich.
reviews.title: Favorite in Munich

reviews.text: The Platzl Hotel is superbly located about 1 block from Marienplatz immediately next to the Hofbrau Haus. The hotel decor/interior is what I would think of as traditional Bavarian with lots of dark wood and not so great natural lighting. Hotel staff are all unfailing pleasant and helpful. I was grateful for their willingness to go along with my mediocre German skills (even though their English was superior).
reviews.title: Superb location, nice hotel, good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked into the least expensive single room. My immediate reaction when I walked in was "hilariously small" but after spending a little time in it, I came to appreciate the very thoughtful layout, careful space utilization and the relatively large bathroom (considering the size of the room). The bed was a dorm sized single but very comfortable and plenty for me. My room literally overlooked that Hofbrau Haus but I was untroubled by noise on Friday and Saturday night which I can only attribute to solid construction. The A/C worked extremely well. For the price paid and the location, I consider this one of the best hotel room deals I have stumbled across.
reviews.title: Central Location for Tourism Visit

reviews.text: Breakfast was the standard European affair with some bacon and eggs thrown in. Coffee was exceptional (why can't we get coffee like this in the States?). The only real knock I have on the hotel is that the breakfast is downstairs in a stuffy, overly warm, claustrophobic, dark room. I didn't care for the location or the lack of open curtains. On the flip side, the kitchen staff was quite pleased to prepare me a box breakfast to take with me to the airport for my early morning departure. Very accommodating.
reviews.title: Fantastic location; great staff; lovely room

reviews.text: Overall, I consider this a superb place to stay and will definitely go back again when I am in Munich. Can't beat the value.
reviews.title: In the heart of Munich

reviews.text: Very professional staff, also clean and modern rooms. Central location adjacent to the City Center and Clock Tower area (Marienplatz). The restaurant next door (Haxenbrauer) is excellent with wonderfule roasted meat dishes.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay at the Platzl

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We couldn't have picked a better place for our short stay in Munich. It was within easy walking distance to all the main attractions in the center of town and everything about the hotel was first class. Our room faced the street, but noise was not a problem. The room was great and we enjoyed a very good breakfast. We had to pay for parking, but it was very convenient as the hotel garage was located directly below the hotel. Free WiFi would have been nice, but it wasn't an issue for us as we were able to use the computer in the lobby for no charge. The staff went our of their way to help us with whatever we needed. We would highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Great hotel in an ideal location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: IO have been to Munich several times for business and pleasure, and have always stayed at the Platzl. The hotel is very nice and the rooms are awesome. I enjoy A/C instead of opening windows, so this is great for me. The rooms and bathrooms are very nice and perfect size. We had a small double and it was plenty. Great location to everything, and you are next door to the Hofbrauhous.
reviews.title: Very Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only complaint is that I think they are starting to rest on their reputation. The price of the room is high compared to what I am guessing are same hotels. For the price range, there should be free wifi in the rooms. I am not sure there is free wifi anywhere in the hotel. The breakfast is great, but it should be for 30 euros. I hope that they step it up or lower their prices. It is definitly a 4 star hotel, and as I said, the only place I can count on to be very good all of the time.
reviews.title: Excellent location and comfortable rooms but really - can't they include WiFi?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a perfect location for exploring old Munich. The staff are friendly, the rooms are comfortable and the breakfast is very good. It's always disappointing when little things that should ideally be included, are charged for at very high rates. One expects free WiFi everywhere these days, so finding that we had to pay for it at what we consider very high rates (15 euros/24 hours) was a disappointment. I need to keep connected with my business even when on vacation and hate to have to expense this sort of thing when it should be free (or at least included in the rate!).
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in the centre of the old town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have just returned from a weekend trip to Munich staying at the Platzl hotel. I chose the Platzl purely on the favourable comments posted on trip Advisor. This is a lovely hotel, and very central for the old town - you step outside and you're there! My only disappointment was that our room was a little on the noisy side - we were at the front of the hotel and with the window open there was a lot of street noise. On our first night the room was very stuffy and we would have welcomed some fresh air but didn't dare open the window because of the noise outside. However, the second night was better, and this did not detract from what is a superb hotel. Breakfast was included in the price and for choice, is one of the most extensive I have witnessed. As well as the hot and cold choices, fresh fruit, German breads etc, etc, you can also ask for white sausage (a specialiaty I understand), fried eggs or waffles at no extra charge. The coffee is proper fresh coffee brought to you table in a pot. The general service from the hotel staff was excellent and the hotel is clean and modern.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Munich!

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Platzl Hotel Munich during a Reinsurance Congress from May 23rd to May 25th 2012. The hotel is very traditional, perfectly located and with all the comfort the modern traveller needs. Unfortunately the hotel also has WiFi (Wireless Internet) installed, which is a pain for electro-sensitive people like me. Luckily enough the WiFi is only installed in the reception area, and if you choose a room on an upper floor, it is possible, you still can sleep at nights (although I know the radiation actually covers the whole house).
reviews.title: Superb Hotel, centrally located, electro-sensitives can 'survive'

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So if you happen to choose the Platz and are electro-sensitive, ask for an upper floor room.
reviews.title: Excellent location & good service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff was very attentive and responsive to my personal situation.
reviews.title: The Perfect Platzl

reviews.text: We stayed at hotel Platzl for 2 nights during our recent visit to Munich and were very pleased with our accommodation choice. The hotel is very conveniently located in the heart of old town, which allows you to come back to the room for an afternoon siesta before heading back to town for dinner in the evening. Rooms are very clean, service great, decor traditional, but certainly has its charm.
reviews.title: everything is nice and ok.

reviews.text: Looking for a great hotel in a fabulous location in Munich? This is it. Our room was smallish but perfect for relaxing and recharging. Although it was air-conditioned, the windows in the room opened on to an inner courtyard. We experienced fresh air and quiet. The room was clean and well-appointed. The bathroom was modern with a great shower /deep tub combo. The breakfast that was included in the price of the room was a sumptuous brunch-like affair. If you left hungry, it was your own fault. And if you travel as we do, it kept you going until dinner. I can't say enough about the staff. They were incredibly polite, out-of-their-way helpful and extremely knowledgeable when it came to what you wanted to see and how to get there. I can't say enough about our experience at this hotel.
reviews.title: Great service and great location

description: 167 rooms, Bavarian 4* superior boutique hotel located in historic downtown area next to the Hofbrauhaus and Marienplatz. All guestrooms renovated in 2007. Complimentary buffet breakfast. Awarded for cuisine in its Bavarian gourmet restaurant Pfistermühle�. Tavern âAyingers specialises in local dishes and draught beer from wooden kegs. Recreation area with sauna, steam-bath and fitness equipment free of charge.
